Question
========
  
A professor of psychology is conducting a study of depressed feelings among students at Utrecht University who are all taking his relaxation therapy. The hypotheses he wants to test are H0: $\mu$ = 3.0 vs. H1: $\mu$ < 3.0. To do this, he plans to use a sample of 25 students who will all complete a questionnaire about depressed feelings (with scores on a 5-point Likert scale). He chooses a significance level of $\alpha$ = 1%. The power is calculated for this test and is found to be only 68%. In which of the following situations will the power not go up? 
Answerlist
----------
* Using a sample of 50 students.
* Testing at $\alpha$ = 5%.
* Calculate the power with a larger expected effect.
* Two-sided testing.
